howto.title: How to Start Mining
howto.subtitle: Complete guide to set up your miner on KORVEX Pool
howto.intro_p1: KORVEX is an independent mining pool for ERGO (ERG), a proof-of-work blockchain based on the Autolykos2 algorithm. The pool is open to everyone, GPU-mineable, and designed for reliability and transparency.
howto.intro_p2: This guide will help you set up your miner and start earning ERG in a few minutes.
howto.server_desc: Connect to the server closest to your location for the best latency and fewer stale shares.
howto.server_note: Additional regions (US, Asia) may be added in the future based on demand.
howto.wallet_desc: You need an ERGO wallet address to receive your mining rewards. Your wallet address is also your mining username — no account registration is needed.
howto.wallet_nautilus: Nautilus Wallet — browser extension, easy to use (recommended)
howto.wallet_warning: Do not use an exchange deposit address. Exchanges may change your address without notice, which could cause lost payments. Always use a personal wallet you control.
howto.software_desc: Autolykos2 is GPU-mineable. Below are the most popular miners with ready-to-use commands. Replace YOUR_WALLET with your ERG address and RIG_NAME with a name for your machine.
howto.software_recommended_desc: These miners have 100% compatibility with KORVEX pool stratum implementation.
howto.software_also_supported_desc: These miners work but may have minor compatibility variations.
howto.srbminer_desc: AMD & NVIDIA — Some users may experience sporadic client-side share rejections due to stratum protocol interpretation differences. Consider using lolMiner or TeamRedMiner for optimal results.
howto.vram_note: GPUs with less than 8 GB of VRAM cannot mine Autolykos2 anymore (the dataset no longer fits in memory).
howto.pplns_desc: KORVEX uses the PPLNS (Pay Per Last N Shares) reward method. When the pool finds a block, the reward is distributed among miners who contributed shares during a recent window of work.
howto.pplns_window: The window is proportional to the network difficulty: the more you mine consistently, the bigger your share of each block. Miners who connect only briefly and disconnect will earn less, because their shares may fall outside the window.
pplns_points: Rewards are based on the difficulty of your submitted shares, not just their count
Mining regularly gives you the best results
The 1% pool fee is deducted before distribution
There are no hidden penalties or charges
howto.payments_desc: Payments are fully automatic. Once your confirmed balance reaches 1 ERG, the pool sends your earnings to your wallet address. Balances are checked every 30 minutes.
payments_points: After a block is found, the pool waits for 720 confirmations (~24 hours) before crediting your balance. This ensures the block is permanently on the blockchain.
If a block becomes orphaned (removed from the chain), no rewards are credited. This is standard behavior for all mining pools.
Network transaction fees (0.001 ERG per payment) are covered by the pool, not deducted from your balance.
howto.stats_desc: Go to the Miner page and enter your wallet address. You will see:
stats_points: Balance — confirmed (ready for payout) and pending (waiting for confirmations)
Payments — history of all sent payments with transaction hashes
howto.stats_note: Stats are updated every minute. It may take a few minutes after your miner connects for the first data to appear.
howto.support_desc: If you have questions or need help, you can reach us through the following channels:
howto.support_note: Please also check the Legal & Terms page for our terms of service and privacy policy.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to the most common questions about mining on KORVEX Pool
faq.rewards_a1: The minimum payout is 1 ERG. Once your confirmed balance reaches this threshold, the pool automatically sends your earnings to your wallet address.
faq.rewards_a2: The pool checks balances every 30 minutes. If your confirmed balance is above 1 ERG, a payment is triggered automatically.
faq.rewards_a3: When a block is found, the reward must wait for 720 confirmations (~24 hours) before it becomes spendable. During this time, your share of the reward appears as "unconfirmed" or "pending".
faq.rewards_a4: An orphan block is a valid block that was found by the pool but was later removed from the blockchain (another pool found a competing block at the same height). No rewards are distributed for orphan blocks.
faq.rewards_q5: Are there transaction fees on payouts?
faq.rewards_a5: The network transaction fee (0.001 ERG per payment) is paid by the pool. Nothing is deducted from your balance.
faq.rewards_q6: I haven't received a payment, what should I do?
faq.rewards_a6: Check your confirmed balance on the Miner page. If it's below 1 ERG, you need to keep mining until the threshold is reached. Also make sure your wallet address is correct and that you are not using an exchange address that has changed.
faq.mining_a1: Pool mining combines the computing power of multiple miners to find blocks faster. When a block is found, the reward is shared among all contributing miners based on the work they submitted (shares).
faq.mining_q2: What is the difference between PPLNS and SOLO?
faq.mining_a2: PPLNS (Pay Per Last N Shares) distributes rewards among all miners who contributed recent shares. SOLO gives the entire block reward to the miner who found it, but blocks are found much less frequently for a solo miner.
faq.mining_a3: A share is a proof of work submitted by your miner that demonstrates your GPU is working. Shares have varying difficulty — the pool uses them to measure your contribution. A share that meets the network difficulty becomes a block solution.
faq.mining_a4: The pool automatically adjusts the difficulty of shares sent to your miner to maintain a target of about 1 share every 15 seconds. Faster GPUs get higher difficulty shares, but this does not affect your earnings — one high-difficulty share is worth the same as multiple lower-difficulty shares.
faq.mining_q5: If I turn off my rig before a block is found, do I lose my work?
faq.mining_a5: In PPLNS, only shares within the current window count. If you stop mining, your shares gradually age out of the window. As long as you were mining recently when the block was found, you will receive a reward proportional to your contribution.
faq.hashrate_q1: How much hashrate do I need to mine ERG?
faq.hashrate_a1: There is no minimum hashrate. Even a single GPU can mine ERG. However, with lower hashrate, it will take longer to accumulate rewards. A typical modern GPU (RTX 3060+) produces around 100-200 MH/s on Autolykos2.
faq.hashrate_q2: Why is my hashrate on the pool lower than in my miner?
faq.hashrate_a2: The pool estimates your hashrate from the shares you submit, which is subject to statistical variance. Over short periods (15 minutes), the pool hashrate can fluctuate significantly. The 1-hour average is more accurate and should be close to your local hashrate.
faq.hashrate_a3: The network hashrate is the total combined computing power of all miners on the ERGO blockchain. A higher network hashrate means more competition and a longer average time between blocks for any given pool.
faq.hashrate_q4: How is the pool hashrate calculated?
faq.hashrate_a4: The pool adds up the difficulty of all shares submitted by all miners in a time window (e.g., 15 minutes or 1 hour) and divides by the time. This gives an estimate of the pool's total computing power.
faq.luck_a1: Effort measures how much work the pool needed to find a block compared to the statistical expectation. 100% effort = the block was found exactly as expected. Below 100% = lucky (found faster). Above 100% = unlucky (took longer).
faq.luck_q2: Is it normal to see effort above 200%?
faq.luck_a2: Yes! Mining is random. Sometimes a block takes twice as long as expected (200%+ effort), and sometimes it's found almost instantly (< 10% effort). Over many blocks, the average effort tends toward 100%.
faq.luck_q3: How long does it take to find a block?
faq.luck_a3: It depends on the pool's hashrate relative to the network. The formula is: Network Hashrate / Pool Hashrate × 2 minutes (average block time). With higher pool hashrate, blocks are found more frequently.
faq.wallet_a1: We recommend Nautilus Wallet (browser extension) for desktop or Ergo Wallet (mobile app) for phones. Both are free, secure, and give you full control of your funds.
faq.wallet_q2: Can I use an exchange address?
faq.wallet_a2: It is not recommended. Exchanges may change your deposit address without notice, which means payments could be sent to an address you no longer control. Always use a personal wallet.
faq.wallet_q3: Which mining software should I use?
faq.wallet_a3: For NVIDIA GPUs, we recommend lolMiner. For AMD GPUs, we recommend TeamRedMiner. Both have 100% compatibility with KORVEX and are easy to configure.
faq.wallet_q4: How do I configure mining on HiveOS?
faq.wallet_a4: In HiveOS, create a new Flight Sheet with: Coin: ERG, Pool: korvexpool.com:3416, Wallet: your ERG address. Select lolMiner (NVIDIA) or TeamRedMiner (AMD) as the miner.

legal.mentions_editor: Site publisher: KORVEX Pool - Operated by an individual
legal.mentions_host: Hosting: OVH SAS - 2 rue Kellermann, 59100 Roubaix, France
legal.cgu1_text: KORVEX is a community mining pool for the ERGO blockchain (Autolykos2 algorithm). By connecting your mining equipment to KORVEX, you accept these terms.
cgu2_items: Payment method: PPLNS (Pay Per Last N Shares)
cgu3_items: KORVEX does not guarantee any income. Mining depends on computing power, network difficulty, and luck.
KORVEX cannot be held responsible for service interruptions (maintenance, outages, updates).
KORVEX cannot be held responsible for losses related to ERG price fluctuations.
Rewards from orphaned or rejected blocks are not distributed.
cgu4_items: Provide a valid ERGO address to receive payments.
Do not attempt to attack or disrupt the pool's operation.
Do not submit invalid shares abusively (limit of 50 invalid shares before temporary ban).
Maximum 10 simultaneous connections per IP address.
cgu5_items: Payments are made automatically when the balance reaches the minimum threshold of 1 ERG.
Network transaction fees on the ERGO network are covered by the pool.
KORVEX reserves the right to modify fees and payout threshold with reasonable notice.
legal.cgu6_text: KORVEX reserves the right to temporarily or permanently ban any miner in case of abuse, attack attempt, or behavior harmful to the pool's operation.
legal.cgu7_text: KORVEX may modify these Terms of Service at any time. Changes take effect upon publication on this page. It is recommended to check this page regularly.
legal.privacy1_desc: KORVEX only collects data necessary for the pool's operation:
privacy1_items: ERGO address: to identify miners and distribute payments
IP address: for security and abuse prevention
Worker name: to distinguish different machines of the same miner
Mining statistics: hashrate, submitted shares, blocks found
legal.privacy2_desc: KORVEX does not collect any personal data such as:
legal.privacy3_desc: Collected data is used exclusively for:
legal.privacy4_text: KORVEX does not sell, rent, or share any data with third parties. ERGO addresses and mining statistics are publicly visible on the dashboard (as is the case with all mining pools).
privacy5_items: Shares are kept for 7 days then automatically deleted.
Hashrate statistics are kept for 90 days.
IP addresses are not permanently stored.
legal.privacy6_text: In accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), you have the right to access, rectify, and delete your data. To exercise these rights, contact: guillaumesastre34@gmail.com
legal.privacy7_text: For any questions regarding this privacy policy: guillaumesastre34@gmail.com

solo.title: Solo Mining
solo.description: 100% block reward to you (minus pool fee)

howtoSolo.title: How to Start Solo Mining
howtoSolo.subtitle: Complete guide to set up solo mining on KORVEX Pool
howtoSolo.intro_p1: Solo mining means you mine independently. When you find a block, you keep 100% of the reward (minus the 1.5% pool fee). However, blocks are found less frequently than with pool mining.
howtoSolo.intro_p2: This guide will help you configure your miner for solo mode on KORVEX Pool.
howtoSolo.comparison_desc: Choosing between solo and PPLNS depends on your hashrate and risk tolerance.
howtoSolo.recommendation_text: If you have less than 1 GH/s, we strongly recommend PPLNS for steady, predictable income. Solo mining is best suited for miners with significant hashrate who are willing to accept long periods without rewards in exchange for potentially larger payouts.
howtoSolo.software_desc: Autolykos2 is GPU-mineable. Below are the most popular miners with ready-to-use commands for solo mode (port 3417). Replace YOUR_WALLET with your ERG address and RIG_NAME with a name for your machine.
howtoSolo.pplns_desc: In solo mode, when you find a block, you receive the entire block reward minus the 1.5% pool fee. No shares are tracked or distributed to other miners.
pplns_points: You only earn when YOUR miner finds a block
The 1.5% pool fee is deducted from the block reward
No minimum hashrate, but higher hashrate = more frequent blocks
Pool handles block submission, confirmation, and payment automatically
